sentence.Network_en: Judging by the opinion polls, he seems to be succeeding.
sentence.Network_cn: 从民意测验来看，他似乎胜券在握。

sentence.Network_en: Let's be brutally honest about this: you haven't a hope of succeeding.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然有点儿残忍,但 老实 说,你没有成功的希望.

sentence.Network_en: Money tends to flow to businesses that are already succeeding.

list.abs: subvariety 子簇succeeding state 后续状态success probability 成功概率

后期旋回后期旋回(succeeding cycle):地槽转化为地台之后的各个构造旋回。 地槽可分为正地槽正地槽和准地槽准地槽; 地台也可分为正地台正地台和准地台准.
后续工作(succeeding activities)：本工作之后至终点节点各条线路上的所有工作；虚工作：即是虚拟的，实际并不存在的工作，它不占 …

entry.tran: 达到目的;成功做成;办到
entry.def: If you succeed in doing something, you manage to do it.

example.ex: We have already succeeded in working out ground rules with the Department of Defense...
example.tran: 我们已经成功地与国防部敲定了基本原则。

example.ex: Some people will succeed in their efforts to stop smoking...
example.tran: 一些人经过努力可以成功戒烟。

entry.tran: 取得预期效果;表现良好
entry.def: If something succeeds, it works in a satisfactory way or has the result that is intended.

example.ex: If marriage is to succeed in the 1990's, then people have to recognise the new pressures it is facing.
example.tran: 在 20 世纪 90 年代人们要想婚姻美满，那就不得不认识到它所面临的新压力。

example.ex: ...a move which would make any future talks even more unlikely to succeed.
example.tran: 可能使今后的所有对话都更加难以取得什么成果的举动

entry.def: Someone who succeeds gains a high position in what they do, for example in business or politics.

example.ex: ...the skills and qualities needed to succeed in small and medium-sized businesses.
example.tran: 经营好中小企业所需的技能和素质

entry.def: If you succeed another person, you are the next person to have their job or position.

example.ex: David Rowland is almost certain to succeed him as chairman on January 1...
example.tran: 戴维·罗兰将在 1 月 1 日接替他任主席几乎已成定局。

example.ex: The present ruler, Prince Rainier III, succeeded to the throne on 9 May 1949.
example.tran: 现任元首，兰尼埃三世亲王于 1949 年 5 月 9 日继位。

entry.def: If one thing is succeeded by another thing, the other thing happens or comes after it.

example.ex: A quick divorce can be succeeded by a much longer — and more agonising — period of haggling over the fate of the family.
example.tran: 闪电式离婚后可能紧接着就是一段在家庭命运上互相纠结的更加漫长、更加痛苦的时期。

means.word_mean: 2. (of elected officers) elected but not yet serving;
